thread.title: Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage Reacts to Lawsuit Filed Against Texas Parks and Wildlife Department
thread.title_full: Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage Reacts to Lawsuit Filed Against Texas Parks and Wildlife Department - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage Reacts to Lawsuit Filed Against Texas Parks and Wildlife Department
text:
Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage
AUSTIN, Texas , Oct. 2, 2015 /PRNewswire/ -- "Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage regrets the lawsuit filed by members of the deer breeding industry against Texas Parks and Wildlife Department.
"In spite of active participation by numerous deer breeding organizations in the construction and approval of the Chronic Wasting Disease (CWD) management plan and the August 19 emergency order, breeders are now opposed to the agreed-upon increased mandatory testing and restrictions on breeder deer movement.
"This lawsuit highlights deer breeders' unwillingness to be accountable for their actions in regard to risks posed to wild populations through the concentration, widespread movement and subsequent liberation of pen-raised breeder deer to intermingle with wild deer.
"Since the discovery of CWD in a captive deer in June, Texas Parks and Wildlife Department's actions have been guided by science, caution, and the utmost concern for Texas' wild deer herds, hunting markets and rural economies.
"While the recent euthanization of the index herd at Texas Mountain Ranch in Medina County is the appropriate response to CWD, it is nonetheless a sad day for all of us who love Texas wildlife.
"We stand by Texas Parks and Wildlife Department's decisions in response to CWD and support continued prudent regulatory protocols."
Jenny Sanders
Executive Director, Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage
About Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage
Launched in 2014, Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage is a coalition of sportsmen and women who value the rich tradition of hunting in Texas. The coalition seeks to promote the values and tradition of sustainable, fair chase hunting to all Texans, while exposing practices that threaten the future of the sport. Texans for Saving Our Hunting Heritage is led by Executive Director Jenny Sanders , with members Ernest Angelo, Jr. , Joseph B. C. Fitzsimons, Stephen J. "Tio" Kleberg , and Dr. Wallace Klussman . Hunt real. Hunt wild. Hunt Texas Proud.
